author: Freya Jones, Joe Mayes
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves should resist the temptation to raise levies on UK companies further because of the risk of strangling economic growth, one of the country’s biggest business lobbies said.
title: Top UK Business Leader Warns Rachel Reeves Not to Hike Corporate Taxes

author: Matthew Brockett
description: New Zealand member of parliament Takutai Moana Natasha Kemp, of the small opposition Māori Party, has died at the age of 50.
title: New Zealand Māori Party MP Takutai Kemp Dies Aged 50

author: Patricia Hurtado
description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the Maryland man who the Trump administration mistakenly deported to a prison in El Salvador, remains in legal limbo after defeating a bid by the government to keep him locked up on criminal charges.
title: Abrego Garcia Ordered Freed, But Faces Re-Arrest by Immigration

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Jenny Leonard
description: The Trump administration has slightly eased recent export limits on a petroleum gas that’s used to make plastics — a shift that represents a modest pullback on curbs used as leverage in trade negotiations with China.
title: US Allows Ethane Cargoes to Sail to China After Inventories Soar

author: Akayla Gardner, Cam Baker
description: Vice President JD Vance is scheduled to headline a political fundraiser in Nantucket in July, according to a person familiar with the matter, courting the Massachusetts island’s wealthy summer crowd to bolster Republicans before the midterm elections.
title: Vance to Attend $250,000 Nantucket Dinner Hosted by Putnam CEO

author: Irina Anghel
description: The UK is seeking to increase the recognition of British professional certifications abroad, a move aimed at boosting the nation’s service-sector exports by making it easier for highly skilled employees to work for clients overseas.
title: Starmer Seeks to Expand Service Exports in UK Trade Strategy

author: Daniel Flatley, Kailey Leinz, Joe Mathieu
description: Deputy Treasury Secretary Michael Faulkender said the expectation is that, following negotiations with US trading partners, tariffs won’t go back as high as the reciprocal levies that President Donald Trump announced on April 2.
title: Treasury’s Faulkender Sees Sub-April 2 Tariff Rates After Talks

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Andrew Oxford
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom and state lawmakers struck a budget agreement that provides $750 million in tax credits for Hollywood while scaling back free health care for undocumented immigrants.
title: California Reaches $321 Billion Budget Deal Boosting Hollywood

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Capitol influence reporter Emily Birnbaum looks at the status of the Republican tax-cut and spending bill with a deadline coming up. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Tax Cut Bill Progress May Hinge on SALT Content

author: Norah Mulinda, Georgie McKay, Natalie Wong
description: Shares of companies linked to New York City real estate fell Wednesday as Zohran Mamdani, a state Assembly member who has vowed to freeze rents, looks all but certain to become the Democratic nominee for mayor.
title: Mamdani’s Rent-Freeze Agenda Sparks Slide in NYC-Linked REITs

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump described Zohran Mamdani, the expected Democratic nominee for New York City mayor, as a “Communist Lunatic,” signaling how Republicans will seek to portray the upstart politician as representative of the party.
title: Trump Slams NYC Mayoral Candidate Mamdani as ‘Communist Lunatic’

author: Michael O'Boyle
description: The US government designated three Mexican financial firms as potential money launderers tied to illicit opioid trafficking, as it seeks to clamp down on cartel financing.
title: US Accuses Three Mexican Financial Firms of Aiding Fentanyl Trafficking

author: Oscar Medina
description: A legal battle has erupted over the attempted assassination of a Colombian presidential candidate, with the nation’s incumbent leftist leader accusing lawyers for the hospitalized conservative senator of slander.
title: Petro Bickers With Lawyers for Colombian Senator Shot in Head

author: Sridhar Natarajan, Laura Nahmias
description: Even Zohran Mamdani’s detractors recognize that the vibes are with the 33-year-old democratic socialist.
title: Mamdani’s Shock Win Has Wall Street Fretting Over ‘Hot Commie Summer’

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: In this episode of Trumponomics, we explore whether Donald Trump’s attack on Iran changes the calculus on his “reciprocal” tariffs and a looming deadline.
title: Can the World Count on ‘TACO’ Anymore?

author: Cam Kettles, Maeve Sheehey
description: House Republicans from high-tax states signaled they’re inching closer to a deal on the state and local tax deduction following a Wednesday meeting with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent.
title: Key Republicans Signal 'Progress' on SALT Deal After Bessent Meeting

author: Bob Van Voris
description: The Massachusetts Institute of Technology was sued by an instructor and a former student who claim the school’s administration failed to address a “hostile anti-Semitic environment” on campus following the Oct. 7, 2023, attacks in Israel by Hamas.
title: MIT Sued by Student, Instructor Over Alleged Campus Antisemitism

author: Andrea Palasciano, Flavia Krause-Jackson, Josh Wingrove
description: It was a reception fit for a king.
title: Royal Pomp and Political Flattery Help Sway Trump on NATO Unity

author: Chris Dolmetsch
description: US Representative LaMonica McIver pleaded not guilty to federal charges that she interfered with law enforcement outside a 1,000-bed immigration detention facility in Newark, New Jersey.
title: NJ Congresswoman Pleads Not Guilty to Obstructing ICE Agents

author: Thomas Seal
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney said he met with European defense suppliers about jets and submarines, and expects to conclude a review of a major contract for Lockheed Martin Corp. F-35 jets as soon as this summer.
title: Carney Says Canada Met With European Suppliers Amid F-35 Review

author: Carter Johnson
description: This month’s geopolitical tension focused on the Middle East is re-establishing the dollar’s traditional inverse relationship with risk assets, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.
title: Middle East War Reset Dollar’s Inverse Link to Stocks, Goldman Says

author: Stephanie Lai, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he has three or four people in mind to succeed Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell when his term expires next year.
title: Trump Says Three or Four People on List to Replace Fed’s Powell

author: Erin Hudson
description: Public school funding in California is at risk after the US Education Department found that the state is violating rules protecting female athletes from unfair competition and unsafe situations “by allowing males in girls’ sports and intimate spaces.”
title: California Schools Risk DC Funding Cuts on Transgender Athlete Debate

author: Stephanie Lai, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump assailed Spain for refusing to agree to new defense spending targets adopted by NATO and suggested the country could be penalized by facing tariffs twice as high from the US.
title: Trump Threatens to Double Spanish Tariffs Over NATO Spending

author: Oliver Crook, Ott Ummelas
description: Finland’s President Alexander Stubb said his nation remains “calm and collected” amid reports of Russian troop buildup near the NATO member’s border.
title: Finnish Leader Urges Calm Amid Russian Buildup Near Border

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Democratic Republic of Congo signed an agreement with Trident Digital Tech Holdings Ltd. of Singapore to develop a national digital identity and e-government system.
title: Congo Signs Digital-Identification Deal With Singapore’s Trident

author: Josh Wingrove, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said the US would hold a meeting with Iran next week but cast doubt on the need for a diplomatic agreement, citing the damage that American bombing had done to its key nuclear sites.
title: Trump Says US and Iran to Talk Next Week, Mideast War Is ‘Over’

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Trump administration defended the president’s power to impose sweeping global tariffs, arguing to a federal appeals court that it should overturn a decision finding the levies unconstitutional.
title: Trump Administration Urges Appeals Court to Back Tariff Power

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan, Patrick Van Oosterom
description: Dutch far-right leader Geert Wilders met with Donald Trump on the sidelines of the NATO Summit in The Hague, where they discussed “the need for tougher immigration laws,” Wilders said in a post on X.
title: Dutch Far-Right Leader Courts President Trump at NATO Summit

author: Lionel Laurent
description: Unrealistic defense spending targets won’t make the transatlantic alliance healthier.
title: Making NATO Great Again Demands More Than Money

author: Emily Birnbaum, Lauren Vella
description: Donald Trump’s top economic adviser on Wednesday said the administration is pushing US trading partners to move swiftly on deals that make the “revenge tax” included in the president’s cornerstone legislation unnecessary.
title: Trade Deals Could Eliminate Need for ‘Revenge Tax’, Hassett Says

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright, Levin Stamm
description: Switzerland and the US are at odds on the agreed price for three dozen F-35A fighter jets the country wants to buy from Lockheed Martin Corp., adding to existing tensions over US tariffs.
title: Swiss Admit Spat With US on Fighter Jet Price, Still Want F-35A

author: Daryna Krasnolutska, Andrea Dudik
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is meeting with Donald Trump at a summit of NATO leaders as he seeks to persuade the US president to sell weapons to Ukraine.
title: Trump Meets With Ukraine’s Zelenskiy on Sidelines of NATO Summit

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump’s policies will reduce US fiscal deficits by up to $11 trillion over the coming decade, according to the White House’s chief economist — a projection that defies analysts who say government debt is poised to climb to record highs in coming years.
title: Trump Policies Will Cut Deficits Up to $11 Trillion, White House Economist Says

author: Stephanie Lai, Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump said he stood behind NATO’s mutual defense obligations after a historic vote by its members to raise their defense spending to 5% of GDP, offering a commitment that will bolster anxious European allies.
title: Trump Offers Backing to NATO Defense Pact: ‘I Stand With It’

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO leaders agreed to increase defense spending to 5% of GDP and renewed their commitment to mutual defense in an historic move that comes at the time of an increasingly belligerent Russia.
title: NATO Leaders Endorse Historic Plan to Boost Defense Spending

author: Dana Khraiche
description: Iran’s Foreign Ministry spokesperson said the country’s nuclear installations were ‘badly damaged’ by US airstrikes, the Associated Press reported, though he didn’t provide further detail.
title: Iran Says Nuclear Sites ‘Badly Damaged’ by US, AP Reports

author: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan, Gregory Korte
description: Zohran Mamdani is poised to become the Democratic nominee for mayor of New York City after the 33-year-old democratic socialist forced his opponent Andrew Cuomo, the former governor of the state, to concede within hours after polls closed.
title: NYC Democrats Rebuke Establishment With Vote for Zohran Mamdani

author: Chris Anstey
description: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the dramatic shift in communication from Washington on trade deals over the past month. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.
title: US Lurches From Verge of Big Trade Deals to Having None in View

author: Kevin Orland
description: Alberta Premier Danielle Smith played down concerns that the secession movement in her province will scare away investors, saying it’s up to the government of Mark Carney to prove Canada can be a more attractive place for capital.
title: Alberta Premier Warns Carney He Must Act to Quell Separatist Threat

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is expected to prod French President Emmanuel Macron to drop his opposition to co-production of a European-made missile-defense system at talks on the sidelines of the NATO summit Wednesday.
title: Erdogan to Push Macron to Finalize Missile System Sale to Turkey

author: Grant Smith
description: Thanks to a decade-long shale boom, the US has emerged as the world’s biggest oil producer.
title: New Oil Geopolitics Laid Bare By Iran Conflict

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump’s budget director is preparing to escalate the administration’s fight over federal spending with a little-tested tactic to claw back money in the last days of the fiscal year.
title: Trump Eyes Little-Tested Tactic for Next Step in Spending Clash

author: Christopher Cannon, Cedric Sam
description: The state and local tax deduction, which primarily benefits wealthier Americans in high-tax areas, is one of the most disputed provisions of Trump’s tax bill.
title: Calculate Your Gain Under a New SALT Cap

author: Andrea Palasciano, Oliver Crook
description: NATO’s Article 5 is “very, very clear” about allies’ commitment to defend one another when attacked, the European Union’s top diplomat said after Donald Trump appeared to question its meaning.
title: EU Top Diplomat Says NATO Mutual Defense Clause Is ‘Very Clear’

author: Taonga Mitimingi, Matthew Hill
description: Zambia asked a South African court to halt the planned burial of ex-President Edgar Lungu, who died June 5, ratcheting up a feud between the current head of state and the former leader’s family.
title: Ex-President’s Funeral Stalled as Zambia, Family Feud in Court

author: Jarrell Dillard
description: A closely watched independent think tank has updated its estimate for when the federal government risks running out of sufficient funds to pay its obligations on time if Congress fails to suspend or lift the nation’s debt limit.
title: Bipartisan Policy Center Sees Debt-Limit X-Date Soon as Aug. 15

author: Paula Doenecke
description: The Swiss government expects US tariffs to remain at the current rate of 10% after the 90-day grace period ends on July 9, as long as negotiations between the two countries continue.
title: Swiss See 10% US Tariffs to Stay After July 9 If Still in Talks

author: Stephanie Lai, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump expressed support for NATO, praising its moves to bolster defense spending as the pact’s leaders look to secure a US commitment to the alliance.
title: Trump Hails NATO Spending Plan, Says With Them ‘All The Way’

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland wants to start exploratory talks on a defense partnership with the European Union as worries about a US retreat from the continent prompt a rethink of security policy in the traditionally neutral country.
title: Switzerland Seeks Defense Cooperation With EU in New Talks

author: Ethan Bronner, Leen Al-Rashdan
description: A fragile ceasefire between Israel and Iran that the US brokered after 12 days of fighting appeared to be holding on Wednesday, with both sides claiming victory in the war.
title: Israel and Iran Both Claim Wins as Trump-Brokered Truce Holds

author: David Herbling
description: Kenyan security forces blocked roads leading to parliament and the president’s office in the capital as thousands of protesters gathered in the city center to mark the first anniversary of anti-government demonstrations in which dozens of people died.
title: Kenya Barricades Parliament on Anniversary of Deadly Protest

author: Andrea Palasciano
description: NATO leaders sought to project confidence that the US will defend allies after President Donald Trump fueled doubts about his administration’s continued commitment to crucial collective obligations.
title: NATO Leaders Play Down Concern Over Trump’s Defense Commitment

author: William Horobin, James Hirai
description: France’s minority government is set to survive a no-confidence vote over pensions as Marine Le Pen’s National Rally party reiterated its plans to abstain.
title: France’s Government Gets a Lifeline From Le Pen’s Far-Right

author: Annie Massa
description: The email hit inboxes on Monday, a tense period after US attacks against Iranian nuclear sites, but before President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire in the war between Israel and Iran.
title: Trump-Inspired ‘Israel Edition’ Coin Pushed During Iran Conflict

author: Lucille Liu
description: Singapore Prime Minister Lawrence Wong emphasized his country’s commitment to maintaining close ties with both the US and China, even as rivalry between the two superpowers continues to rattle global stability.
title: Singapore PM Touts Good Ties With US, China Amid Trade Tensions

author: Alastair Gale, Haslinda Amin
description: It will take “a generation” to diversify some of the US dependency on China for rare earths and other pieces of global supply chains, but that doesn’t mean Beijing holds the economic upper hand over Washington, former US Deputy Secretary of State Kurt Campbell said.
title: China Doesn’t Hold Upper Hand Against US, Biden Official Says

author: Macarena Munoz Montijano, Kriti Gupta, Guy Johnson
description: Spain’s Economy Minister Carlos Cuerpo has said the country will increase its defense expenditure as much as necessary to achieve NATO capability goals, but is sticking to its resistance to a goal of 5% of GDP.
title: Cuerpo Says Spain Defense Spending Is Enough to Meet NATO Needs

author: James Mayger
description: The European Union wants China to resolve the current shortage of rare earth magnets before a meeting of their leaders next month, according to the bloc’s top envoy to Beijing.
title: EU Wants China to Resolve Rare Earth Issue Before Summit in July

description: The venue of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization summit in The Hague, Netherlands. Photographer: Simon Wohlfahrt/Bloomberg
title: Follow NATO’s Latest Summit as Internal Tensions Simmer

author: Giang Nguyen, Sing Yee Ong
description: Vietnam is seeking urgent discussions with Russia in an effort to accelerate its nuclear energy program, flagging risks to the country’s goal of having a reactor in operation by the end of the decade.
title: Vietnam Seeks Urgent Talks With Russia to Speed Nuclear Energy

author: Nancy Cook
description: Donald Trump’s frenzied second term enters a crucial stretch in the coming weeks as the president juggles a fragile ceasefire between Israel and Iran, a discordant party that he needs to pass his top legislative priority and a global economy on tenterhooks awaiting his next move on tariffs.
title: Trump Enters Fraught Two-Week Run as Tax, Trade Deadlines Loom

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: Beijing vowed to respond to Taiwan’s “technological blockades” after the self-ruled island blacklisted Chinese companies including Huawei Technologies Co., limiting their ability to develop cutting-edge artificial intelligence.
title: China Vows ‘Forceful Measures’ After Taiwan’s Huawei Export Curb

author: Lucille Liu, Linda Lew
description: Premier Li Qiang has projected confidence that China can turn consumption into a driver for the economy, while also casting his nation as a stabilizing force in a rapidly shifting global trade landscape.
title: China Building ‘Mega-sized Consumption Powerhouse,’ Premier Says

author: Fran Wang
description: China’s Finance Minister Lan Fo’an warned emerging countries are running short of money to spend on cross-border infrastructure, in remarks at a meeting of a multilateral lender based in Beijing.
title: China’s Lan Laments Decline of Aid in Speech to Development Bank

author: Grace Sihombing, Haslinda Amin
description: Indonesia’s finance minister expects the budget deficit this year to come in at 2.5% of gross domestic product, as initially projected and well below the 3% ceiling mandated by law.
title: Indonesia On Track to Keep Modest Budget Deficit, Indrawati Says

author: Akayla Gardner
description: The US Housing and Urban Development Department, whose headquarters in Washington is up for sale, plans to move at least some of its operations into another federal building just outside the city amid a broader Trump administration campaign to consolidate government costs.
title: HUD Plans to Move Operations From Washington to Virginia

author: Sakura Murakami
description: Japan filed a complaint with China after detecting new construction activities in the East China Sea, according to a statement released by Japan’s foreign ministry on Tuesday.
title: Japan Protests Fresh Chinese Activity in East China Sea

author: Gregory Korte
description: More than 930,000 New Yorkers cast their ballots so far in the city’s Democratic primary, with more than half withstanding record temperatures to vote at polling stations on Tuesday.
title: New Yorkers Withstand Scorching Heat to Choose Mayoral Candidate

author: Simone Iglesias
description: Brazil was told by the Chinese government that President Xi Jinping will miss the summit of BRICS leaders that will take place in Rio de Janeiro next month, according to a government official familiar with the matter.
title: China Tells Brazil Xi Jinping Will Miss BRICS Summit in Rio

author: Eko Listiyorini, Agnieszka de Sousa
description: Indonesia has trimmed spending plans for what could still be the world’s second-most expensive free meals program, offering modest relief from fiscal pressures as President Prabowo Subianto advances a host of big-ticket projects.
title: Indonesia Cuts Outlay on Giant Free Meals Program to $21 Billion
